title: Virtual Reality-Based Pharmacy Education Design for Clinical Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pharmaceutical knowledge and clinical practice experience
context.additional_context: Practice-oriented education for current pharmacists and pharmacy professionals

learning_goals: Learners can analyze patient symptoms and drug interactions in a virtual reality environment to formulate appropriate treatment plans.
Learners improve rapid decision-making skills by experiencing diverse clinical scenarios in VR simulations.

In a two-week project-based assessment, learners must propose multidisciplinary solutions (medicine: diagnostic protocols, engineering: medical device design, data science: patient data analysis) for at least two of three provided clinical cases and achieve an "Excellent" rating (4+ points on a 5-point scale) in four of five rubric criteria: problem definition, appropriateness of approach, creativity, feasibility, and clarity of results.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
